gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.po
Class PoCache<K extends Serializable & Comparable<? super K>,P extends PersistentObject<K>>

java.lang.Object
  gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.po.PoCache<K,P>
Type Parameters:
P - Type of PersistentObject.
K - Type of PersistentObject key.
public class PoCache<K extends Serializable & Comparable<? super K>,P extends PersistentObject<K>>
extends Object

Dynamic cache for persistent objects.
This class fetches persistent objects from the database and keeps them in a cache so that the next time the same object is asked, it can be fetched from the local cache.
The purpose of this class is to keep objects that are not expected to be modified.

Constructor Detail

PoCache

public PoCache(Class<P> poClass,
               int maxSize,
               Modification<P> modification)
Creates a new PoCache object.

Parameters:
modification - Modification to apply to the objects being read. Optional, this can be null.
poClass - Persistent class.
maxSize - Size of cache. If set to 0 then objects read will not be cached.
Method Detail

get

public P get(K key)
Fetches the persistent object with the specified key searching it first in the local cache and then in the data store.
If the object is retrieved from the local cache, then it is re-attached to the current session.

Parameters:
key - Key of the persistent object being searched.
Returns:
Returns the persistent object with the specified key. If there is no PersistentObject found with the specified key, then returns null.
Throws:
RuntimeException - That wraps any InitializationException or DataException caught during the read operation.

set

public void set(P po)
Puts the specified persistent object in the cache, so that future calls to get(key) will return this element for the specified key. This method is useful in unit testing by putting fixture objects in the cache and thus imitating the behavior of a system that would read these fixtures from the database.

Parameters:
po - Persistent object to put in the cache.
